definition: to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to call a conference/to convene a meeting

sentences.english: We'll be late for the meeting if we stay any longer.
sentences.chinese: 再不走我们开会就要迟到了。

sentences.english: Rachel watches Ben while Ross has a meeting, and she teaches him all about practical jokes.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯开会，瑞秋替他照看儿子班并教他恶作剧。

sentences.english: Be on time to meetings-early if you can.
sentences.chinese: 开会记得准时，能早点到更好。

sentences.english: He knew the time of the meeting.
It won't hurt to postpone the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 不妨把开会时间往后延。

sentences.english: An a mountainous area county attends a meeting research agriculture and rural economics job.
sentences.chinese: 一个山区县开会研究农业和农村经济工作。

sentences.english: How about we stop buying Bud Light for every meeting?
sentences.chinese: 我们每次开会不再买百威啤酒怎么样？

sentences.english: This is the place where the clericals have their meetings.
sentences.chinese: 这里是教权主义支持者们开会的地方。

sentences.english: So I'm on the road a bit, and I hold meetings, sometimes at the client's place.
sentences.chinese: 我才刚刚起步，有时候我在客户提供的地点开会。

sentences.english: We still have to decide about a date for the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我们还要决定一个开会的日期。

sentences.english: Is there any way he can bring the file to the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 他有办法把文件带来开会吗？

sentences.english: Round everybody up. It’s time for our business meeting.
sentences.chinese: 叫大家集合，开会时间到了。

sentences.english: Could we have a word before you go to the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你去开会之前，咱们能私下说句话吗？

sentences.english: The lion king called the twelve zodiac meeting to discuss what row seating.
sentences.chinese: 狮子大王召集十二生肖开会，商量排座次的事。

sentences.english: She always has a gormless look in meetings.
sentences.chinese: 开会她总是一副一脸茫然的表情。

definition: to whisper and chat (instead of listening during a meeting or lecture)
to call a conference/to convene a meeting
to report/to give an account of/report
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
to talk (with sb)/to have a conversation/talk/conversation/CL:次[ci4]
